docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, March 2--President Roosevelt has approved "The Act of Chapultepec" ranging the armed forces of the United States against any American nation that hampers the war effort by violating the territorial integrity or political independence of...
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, March 2--President Roosevelt has approved "The Act of Chapultepec" ranging the armed forces of the United States against any American nation that hampers the war effort by violating the territorial integrity or political independence of another American State, it was learned today.

headline.main: Chapultec Plan to Keep Peace In Americas Seen Sure to Pass; Roosevelt Approves Declaration Providing for Use of Force to Bar Aggression-- Non-Intervention Policy Buried

docs.snippet: FROM Montevideo comes word that Uruguay is issuing 5milesimos, 1-centesimo, 2c  and 5c stamps to commemorate the birth of Josh Pedro Varela (1845-1879), writer, journalist, statesman and educator.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 20-- President Roosevelt called upon the American people in an appeal broadcast tonight over national radio networks to "oversubscribe" the 1945 War Fund of the American Red Cross, for which $200,000,000 is requested.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 20-- President Roosevelt called upon the American people in an appeal broadcast tonight over national radio networks to "oversubscribe" the 1945 War Fund of the American Red Cross, for which $200,000,000 is requested.

headline.main: ROOSEVELT URGES GIFTS TO RED CROSS; Broadcasts Plea to Country to Oversubscribe Fund, Put at $200,000,000 for Year TELLS SERVICES ABROAD 'Never Has Agency Performed So Many Tasks So Well'-- Brooklyn at 51% of Goal TEXT OF PRESIDENT'S PLEA BOWERY GIVES $2,000 Brooklyn Reaches 51% of Goal in City's Red Cross Drive
